programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Exclusive takes on the biggest news, stars, and stories from UFC.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: From the Sphere in Las Vegas.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Bay FC's inaugural season rolls on versus Racing Louisville. Bay FC won their last match 1-0 over Angel City behind Tess Boade's third of the year. On June 23, Louisville rookie Reilyn Turner withstood a gut-punch to salvage a 1-1 draw with Seattle.

programme.title: Formula 1 Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Featuring pre-race predictions and analysis leading up to today's Formula 1 racing action.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Max Verstappen runs hot into Red Bull's home race as the Austrian Grand Prix revs up. Verstappen has won three of the last four events despite a shrinking gap to the rest of the grid, and became the first four-time winner in Austria in 2023.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Liberty return to action against the Dream. New York's bid for back-to-back Commissioner's Cup titles was foiled by Minnesota on June 25. New York has won seven of the last eight meetings with Atlanta after taking two in Georgia earlier in June.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Caitlin Clark road show continues as her Fever visit the Valley of the Sun to play the Mercury. The clubs split four meetings last season with each winning once at home. Diana Taurasi (PHO) averaged 17.5 points in that quartet of contests.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Cole Irvin's Orioles host the Rangers. Irvin was 6-2 with a 2.87 ERA before going 0-2 and yielding 17 runs (12 earned) in 14 1/3 innings over his last three outings. Austin Hays (BAL) is 4-for-10 with two home runs versus Texas starter Andrew Heaney.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Orlando Magic are considered the fairytale team of the mid-'90s whose popularity grew, in part, due to players like Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: The training and development of professional Ultimate Fighters.

programme.title: Fútbol Americas
programme.desc: A bi-weekly soccer debate show hosted Sebastian Salazar and Herculez Gomez with a focus on the young promising generations of the USMNT and EL TRI from both the club and country perspective.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds' relentless battle to clear his name reveals systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete's legacy. As the documentary makes clear, the real truth is found beyond the headlines.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Celtics and Lakers played three riveting NBA Finals in a four-year span during the mid-1980s that fueled the popularity of the league and set the stage for the tremendous growth and heightened profile the NBA has enjoyed since.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Boston's Larry Bird and LA's Magic Johnson headline rosters full of charisma and talent as their teams collide in the epic 1984 NBA Finals. The two had previously met in the 1979 NCAA Championship Game, and now welcomed a second title clash.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: When the Celtics and Lakers meet again in the 1985 and 1987 NBA Finals, the teams' disdain and animosity for each other gradually turns to mutual respect -- led by superstars Magic Johnson and Larry Bird.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: A year in the life of transgender high school track and field sprinter Matt Dawkins, an athlete just trying to be himself.

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts
programme.desc: Mack Beggs, a transgender wrestler from Euless, Texas, struggles against the outside forces that stigmatize transgender athletes.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Members of the Missouri football team band together after teammate Michael Sam tells them he's gay. The team's acceptance and commitment to each other helps fuel the Tigers' run to the SEC East Championship.

programme.title: Premier Lacrosse League
programme.desc: From TCO Stadium in Eagan, Minn.

programme.desc: From Ventura, Calif.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: On June 15, 2011, Vancouver hosts Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Canucks and Boston Bruins; the city is a hive of nervous energy with the home team on the verge of its first-ever title, but when Boston stuns the Canucks to win the Cup, the situation quickly devolves into a full-blown riot, an orgy of violence that sees cars overturned and burned, windows shattered, businesses looted, and lawlessness reign... as hundreds of cell phone cameras capture it all.

programme.title: X Games Ventura 2024
programme.desc: From Ventura, Calif.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embark on a chase of one of the game's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Gotham FC (8-3-3) end a three-game run at home by hosting the Reign (2-9-3). Gotham's five-match win streak was halted by a second 2-0 defeat to Washington this year on June 23. Seattle lost the last two 2023 clashes to Gotham by a combined 6-1 line.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds' relentless battle to clear his name reveals systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete's legacy. As the documentary makes clear, the real truth is found beyond the headlines.

programme.desc: The Royals and Guardians fire up another set with the first of four. Bobby Witt Jr. (KC) registered two home runs, four RBIs and two stolen bases in a two-game split against Cleveland in early June. Ben Lively (CLE) won six of his last seven turns.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Tyrese Haliburton had 35 points, which Knicks guard Donte DiVincenzo matched, but it was not enough as the Pacers got a critical 111-106 victory in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference semifinals.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Kyrie Irving scored 22 points, including a running left-hander in the lane in the final minute to help the Mavs hold on beating Oklahoma City 105-101 to secure a 2-1 lead in the Western Conference semifinals.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Jamal Murray swished a step-back 15-footer over Anthony Davis at the buzzer, giving the Denver Nuggets a stunning, 101-99, win over the Los Angeles Lakers and capping a comeback from a 20-point second-half deficit.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Evan Mobley blocked Franz Wagner's layup in the final seconds and Cleveland survived a scare from Orlando, holding off Paolo Banchero and the Magic, 104-103, in Game 5 to take a 3-2 lead in their Eastern Conference series.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Josh Hart raised his arms and extended three fingers on each hand on his go-ahead 3-pointer with 24.4 seconds left that was finally enough to help send the New York Knicks past the 76ers, 118-115, in Game 6 and into the second round of the playoffs.

programme.title: What If?
programme.desc: Rewriting NBA history, such as if Nets had drafted Kobe Bryant, if the Bulls had traded the pick that became Michael Jordan, if the Timberwolves didn't pass on Steph Curry, if the Sonics didn't trade Scottie Pippen and many more.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Jimmy Butler scored 28 points - the last of them on a step-back jumper as time expired - to give the Miami Heat a thrilling 118-116 victory over the Chicago Bulls. From Dec. 16, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup

programme.title: Béisbol Esta Noche
programme.desc: Si usted es un fanático del béisbol, entonces no querrá perderse esta noche de recapitulación donde se muestran los momentos más destacados de todos los juegos y actualizaciones de los que siguen en curso. Regularmente presentado por Karl Ravech, quien está acompañado por una combinación de analistas, como los ex jugadores John Kruk y Dave Winfield, el ex manager Terry Francona, y los periodistas Tim Kurkjian y Buster Olney.
